intro: Telanthera mollis, commonly known as the soft telanthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine pubescence. Telanthera mollis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
